title: The Duel
description: Moments before he leaves for New York for a meeting with David Wallace, Michael tells Andy that Angela and Dwight are seeing each other. Andy and Dwight then decide to have it out in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [answering the phone] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. I'm sorry, he's not in yet. Would you like his voicemail?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [heard yelling from the street] Yeah! Yeah! Yeah, okay! Twelve miles an hour. Eat that, Carl Lewis!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela made several 911 calls about cars going too fast in front of the building, so the police put up a radar gun. It's actually caused a bit of a traffic hazard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [yelling as he runs past the radar gun] Aah!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Wow, thirteen!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No, no. There was wind.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was just jogging.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, there was wind. I want a do-over.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no, it's not your turn. All right, thirteen is the new number. Oscar, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want another try. Here we go! [Michael runs past the radar as a car passes] Thirty-one! Thirty-one!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: There was a car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was ahead of the car. Thirty-one is my new number.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thirty-one is humanly impossible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go, Oscar. Thirty-one's my number.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's impossible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Beat it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today's a big day. My presence has been requested by [in an authoritative voice] Chief Financial Officer, David Wallace. [in normal voice] He says that he wants to talk about big picture stuff. And, I'll be honest, I have little or no idea what that means, so... probably bad.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Quick announcement:

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy still doesn't know that Angela's having an affair with Dwight. And it's been seventeen days. I mean, eventually he'll figure it out, when their kids have giant heads and beet-stained teeth. But right now it's just... awkward.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] How can he still not know?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We can't figure that out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't take it anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, what?  You can't take what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am telling Andy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. You can't do that. It shouldn't come from you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who should it come from, then?

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: [simultaneously] Angela.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Are you still having intercourse with her? [Dwight's expression implies 'yes']

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What is wrong with you? She is engaged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you ever have intercourse in this office? [Dwight's expression implies 'yes']

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Are you serious? Ugh. Where? [Dwight stares at Oscar; more forcefully] Where? [Dwight's expression implies 'at your desk'; Oscar's voice breaks] Where, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coolly] Seems like you already know where.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin, you screwed this form up again. The amount owed goes at the top.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't realize I was doing something wrong. If I had, I would've admitted it, and stopped right away.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That's enough.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Because I wouldn't want an innocent person, who doesn't know anything about the form... [Angela puts headphones on; Kevin looks at Oscar] What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That was good... It's just, at the end you weren't saying something that could also apply to the form.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: How about, "I'm sorry I did such a whorish job filling out this form?"

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on the phone] That cannot be true! [Dwight jumps] You're going to charge me a fee to cut my own cake? Uh, no. No, no, no. What I'm saying is, I want to cut it myself...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering to Jim] Trade seats with me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I've got a better angle on Pam. I can see everything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Please stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [grabs a spoon from Jim's coffee cup and checks behind him with it] I need a soup spoon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Rule 17:

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [moves his bobblehead from one side of his nameplate to the other and clears his throat to get Angela's attention]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You've got to tell Andy about us.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That is a terrible idea. One of your worst.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get it over with. Then we don't have to hide anymore.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You're expanding on your worst idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you love me or not?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I've already admitted that I do. Why do you keep making me repeat it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Because you're engaged to Andy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not yet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: When what? [clears throat] When what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know this can't go on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What can't go on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have to put an end to this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Seems like...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on. [Dwight and Jim follow into Michael's office]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You guys should... be hearing what I'm saying.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is really not how this is supposed to happen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angela said she was going to tell him. She's just not ready.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When will she be ready?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is she crazy in bed?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [boastfully] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop. What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How so, specifically?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, listen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This shouldn't happen at work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And flexible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This shouldn't be coming from his boss. And we should also consider the fact that that man has an anger issue.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's too late.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well it's not too late, because you haven't done anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am already walking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, once this gets out... I don't know how it's going to go down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, what does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Might get ugly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Jim, this has to get out, so we can all deal with it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But you're leaving...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Michael, who opens the door to leave] Have a good trip.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks. [to Andy] Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Walk with me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Will do, boss-man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh, I do not have much time... car's all the way over there, to tell you what I have to tell you. And just bear in mind when I say... say these things, that... are bad things... that you hear... in your ears... this is something that I, if I were you, that I wouldn't want to hear...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're not making any sense.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well... no, I'm not. So I... I'm not very articulate today, so I'll just leave it for another time. Another day.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All righty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Which will be fine. I am off!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Have a good meeting!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you! [gets into his car]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [through the car window] Kick Wallace's ass!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [through the car window] Okay. I will... Dwight and Angela are having an affair, so...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I can't hear you through the glass

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [rolls down car window] Dwight and Angela are having an affair. They've been sleeping together for some time. That was the news. I wanted to let you know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. See you later. [backs out of the parking space] Ahh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep. [drives off]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I knew something bad was gonna happen today.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You said that yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah, my neighbor got murdered.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Dwight] What are you standing for?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If I'm sitting, I can't disable his neck or his groin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're not going to do anything to his neck or his groin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If I'm sitting, I don't have the option to.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, I'm in charge when Michael's gone, and I need you to sit...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [enters the office and walks to Angela] I need to talk to you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We can talk right here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I need to talk to you in private.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We're not listening.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's go to the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is it true?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What have you heard?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That you're sleeping with Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That doesn't sound like me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is it true?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Andy, I'm engaged to you. I mean, we just signed off on our wedding flowers. Would I have said yes to formal chrysanthemums if I didn't want to get married? And, we went through all that stuff with our wedding cake...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just answer the question. Are you sleeping with Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: A little bit.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How long has it been going on?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't know. I mean, we were together, and then he killed sprinkles, and then we stopped, and... I don't know exactly when we started up again.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who else knows about it?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who else?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [quietly] Let me think about it... I, um... there... [Andy looks over to see everyone watching them]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh God. Come on!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: So listen, Michael, your branch has been doing great lately, and your sales staff is reporting very strong numbers. Out-performing last year, in fact. Um, and I don't know exactly how to put this, but... what are you doing right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right what?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Utica, Albany, all the other branches are struggling, but your branch is reporting strong numbers. [Michael smiles] Look, you're not our most traditional guy, but clearly, something you are doing... is right. And I just, I need to get a sense of what that is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David, here it is. My philosophy is basically this. And this is something that I live by. And I always have. And I always will. Don't ever, for any reason, do anything to anyone, for any reason, ever, no matter what. No matter... where. Or who, or who you are with, or, or where you are going, or... or where you've been... ever. For any reason, whatsoever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sometimes I'll start a sentence, and I don't even know where it's going. I just hope I find it along the way. Like an improv conversation. An improversation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is going to sound sort of high-maintenance, but could we have it, like, three degrees cooler in here? I always think better when it's cooler.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Here's the thing. Michael is doing something right. And in this economic climate, no method of success can be ignored. It's not really time for executives to start getting judgmental now. It's Hail Mary time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [pokes his head in] Hey, what say we order up some pasta?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What say we do.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Standard, you know? Nothing fancy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So like, missionary...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I said nothing fancy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you love him?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I love you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why should I believe that?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Andy, we are at a crossroads here. And we can either give in to what people are saying that we're not good together.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who says that?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Or, we can prove them wrong. Let's prove them wrong.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Where's Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You okay, man?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. Not at all, actually. But thanks for asking. Appreciate it. You know what? I'd also like to take this opportunity to thank all of you for lying. To my face. And not telling me what's been going on this entire time.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You are welcome.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Dwight enters] Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh good. She broke up with you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. It's over between you two.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, no way. I am not giving up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You have to.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No I don't.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [forcefully] She doesn't love you. She's marrying me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [angrier] Well I don't know about that, because she certainly seems to enjoy making lovemaking with me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Angela Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Will never be her name.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It will be her name. And you will have to call her that!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey guys, why don't we, uh, just cool off a bit?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm telling you to back down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I'm telling you that I will never back down.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Then I'll make you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh really? How are you gonna do that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Through the use of force.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is very general, and does not scare me in the slightest.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I will fight you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, fine! Good! A duel! The winner gets Angela.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fine!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This is nuts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is your weapon?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you know what? That's enough. Because...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, this is none of your business.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. It is my business when it happens at work.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guess what? Not happening at work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We're gonna do it outside.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Outside of work.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: None of your business.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: None of your business then. [Dwight and Andy high five] Good. So what weapon?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My bare hands.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is stupid. I will use a sword and I will cut off your bare hands.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Then I'll get something too.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I've had two men fight over me before. Usually it's over which one gets to hold the camcorder.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela, you have to put a stop to this right now.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [thinks for a moment] I will respect the results of the duel.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of course you will.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I call loser!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I will be taking my break at 4:00 in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will also be talking my break at the exact same time and in the same location.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [softly] What a coincidence.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, I either get more involved, or I take a sick day... leaving Dwight in charge. Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [collects Dwight's weapons from around the office; holds up a hand scythe]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [innocently] How'd that get there?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: There's a star-shaped thing taped under the kitchen table.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I was in the office, and I look over to our Accounting division, and there is Kevin Malone. Kevin is wearing a jacket that I've never seen before. And I call over to Kevin, "Kevin, is that a tweed jacket?" And he looks at me and he says, "Michael, yes it is a tweed jacket." And I look back at him and I say, "I feel the need!... The need for tweed."

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It's hard to try and evaluate yourself, Michael, but I appreciate you trying. [gets up] And thanks for coming in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [rises] Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have to say, I am so impressed with the potential you see in me.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [sits back down to continue eating]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [opens his office door] Yeah, finish up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [shouting] Come on! Where are you? Let's do this thing! Come on! Come on out!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [watching from the conference room] I can't believe they're gonna fight over me.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I guess people have fewer choices as they get older.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, has anything happened yet?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where are you?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Mm-mm. It's 4:10, I don't think he's gonna show.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh come on, man! Believe in something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, coward! Where are you? Where... [spots a note attached to the bushes; goes to read it] "From the desk of Andrew Bernard." [scoffs] A note. Pathetic. "Dear Dwight, by now you have received my note. How are you? I am well. You are no doubt wondering why I have left this note. It has come to my attention that in any physical match with you, I would surely be bested." True. "The soft underbelly of my refined upbringing is my soft underbelly..." [as Dwight continues to read, Andy drives around the corner very slowly]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: There's Andy, he's in his car. You guys, what is he doing?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Why isn't Dwight turning around?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The Prius is silent if he keeps it under five miles per hour. He deserves the win.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [still reading] Alas, after much consideration and deliberation...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What's happening?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Andy's running over Dwight with his car.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa! What are you! Hey! Hey!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on! Ow! Ah! Aah!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You give up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Never! [hits Andy's car with his bike chain] Get out and face me like a man!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am a man! I'm a bigger man than you'll ever be! I would never sleep with another man's fiance!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're not a man! You don't know how to take care of her! [hits his car with the bike chain] All you do is dress fancy and sing. [imitating Andy] "La la la la la la la la la la!" What does that mean? You can't even protect her!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Protect her from what? Bears, you idiot? When's the last time you saw a damn bear in Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Last year, idiot! [hits his car with the bike chain]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight! Are your legs broken?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. My right one's falling asleep a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, are you all right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Go away, Tuna! I'm winning this!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, back off. This isn't your fight. Oh, how much is this gonna cost? [hits his car with the bike chain] Oh! What? Trust fund will take care of that! [hits his car with the bike chain]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What did you say? I'm sorry, I couldn't hear you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I sa- [Andy honks his horn]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? You stupid idiot! [Andy honks his horn] You're like, you're like a Sasquatch! You live in the woods...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sasquatches are the strongest animal on the planet! So fine, call me a Sasquatch!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't get it! How can she be sleeping with you this whole time and only sleep with me twice?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She's sleeping with you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm her fiance.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She said she was only sleeping with me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [enters, followed by Dwight, and makes a call] Yes, hi, my last name is Bernard, and I would like to cancel a wedding cake that I had ordered. B-E-R, N-A, R-D. Yeah, the one shaped like a sailboat... Yep, that's the one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [picks up his bobblehead and throws it in the trash can]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, what a day! Haha! I thought I was gong to get chewed out, but, hold on! Here's an attaboy for ya! What? Rollercoaster ride! Rollercoaster! It just goes to show, you leave Scranton, exciting things can happen. [sighs] Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as Jim is collecting weapons, runs to the couch near reception and pulls out a crossbow; Jim catches him and he hands it over]
